text: It is sometimes necessary to do something unforgivable in order to be able to go on living.

text: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.

text: First we make our habits, then our habits make us.

text: Leaders are made, they are not born. They are made by hard effort.

text: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existence.

text: Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance.

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

text: Celebrate any progress. Don't wait to get perfect.

author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work in hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.

text: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.

text: With realization of one's own potential and self-confidence in one's ability, one can build a better world.
author: Dalai Lama

text: From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow.
author: Aeschylus

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

author: Buddha

text: Don't let yesterday take up too much of today.

text: The past is a ghost, the future a dream. All we ever have is now.

text: The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.

text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.

text: The bad news is time flies. The good news is you're the pilot.
author: Michael Altshuler

text: Time management is an oxymoron. Time is beyond our control, and the clock keeps ticking regardless of how we lead our lives.
author: Rory Vaden

text: Don't be fooled by the calendar. There are only as many days in the year as you make use of.
author: Charles Richards

text: The shorter way to do many things is to do only one thing at a time.
author: Mozart

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: The secret of your success is determined by your daily agenda.
author: John C. Maxwell

text: You will never find time for anything. If you want time, you must make it.
author: Charles Buxton

text: The common man is not concerned about the passage of time, the man of talent is driven by it.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: The key is in not spending time, but in investing it.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Until we can manage time, we can manage nothing else.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Time is the scarcest resource and unless it is managed nothing else can be managed.
author: Peter Drucker

text: The great dividing line between success and failure can be expressed in five words: 'I did not have time.'
author: Franklin Field

text: Time = life; therefore, waste your time and waste your life, or master your time and master your life.
author: Alan Lakein

text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

text: The trouble is, you think you have time.
author: Buddha

text: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
author: Auguste Rodin

text: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Punctuality is the thief of time.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: Time you enjoy wasting, was not wasted.
author: John Lennon

text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.'
author: Lao Tzu

text: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
author: Pericles

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Time is what keeps everything from happening at once.
author: Ray Cummings

text: The present time has one advantage over every other - it is our own.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Time is the most indefinable yet paradoxical of things; the past is gone, the future is not come, and the present becomes the past even while we attempt to define it.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: Time is the coin of your life. It is the only coin you have, and only you can determine how it will be spent.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
author: Delmore Schwartz

text: Time is the moving image of eternity.
author: Plato

text: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
author: Faith Baldwin

text: Time is a storm in which we are all lost.
author: William Carlos Williams

text: Time is a circus always packing up and moving away.
author: Ben Hecht

text: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
author: Hector Berlioz

text: Time is the greatest innovator.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Time is the most valuable thing on earth: time to think, time to act, time to extend our fraternal relations, time to become better men, time to become better women.
author: Thomas A. Buckner

text: Time is the one thing we can never get back. Once it's gone, it's gone forever.
author: Unknown

text: Time is the friend of the wonderful business, the enemy of the mediocre.
author: Warren Buffett

text: Time is the most precious element of human existence. The successful person knows how to put energy into time and how to draw success from time.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: Time is the most undefinable yet paradoxical of things; the past is gone, the future is not come, and the present becomes the past even while we attempt to define it.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

text: Time is the wisest counselor of all.
author: Pericles

text: Time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

text: Time is the school in which we learn, time is the fire in which we burn.
author: Delmore Schwartz

text: Time is the moving image of eternity.
author: Plato

text: Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
author: Faith Baldwin

text: Time is a storm in which we are all lost.
author: William Carlos Williams

text: Time is a circus always packing up and moving away.
author: Ben Hecht

text: Time is a great teacher, but unfortunately it kills all its pupils.
author: Hector Berlioz

text: Time is the greatest innovator.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Time is the most valuable thing on earth: time to think, time to act, time to extend our fraternal relations, time to become better men, time to become better women.
author: Thomas A. Buckner
